Features•mike-agency•1 week ago

Is the monday.com mobile app actually usable?

mobileappiosandroidremote-work
37

I manage a team of technicians who are on client sites 80% of the time. We need to: • Update job status from the field • Upload photos of completed work • Access project details and client info • Track time on jobs • Get notifications for urgent updates The monday.com mobile app reviews are mixed. Some say it's great, others say it's limited. For those using it in the field — what's the reality? Can it replace laptop access for day-to-day work? Any tips for making it work better?

2 Answers

28
brucefieldsvc•6 days ago•Accepted

I manage 30 field techs using monday.com mobile daily. Here's the real story:

What works great: • Status updates — one tap, done • Photo uploads — camera integration is smooth • Push notifications — instant and reliable • Offline mode — updates sync when connection returns • Time tracking — start/stop timer is easy

What's frustrating: • Complex boards are hard to navigate on mobile • Can't edit formulas or automations • Dashboards don't render well (use board views instead) • Search is limited

For field work specifically: • Create mobile-friendly board views with only essential columns • Use the 'Cards' view on mobile — much better than table • Set up QR codes at job sites that link directly to monday.com items • Train techs to use voice-to-text for updates

Verdict: For status updates, photos, and time tracking, it's excellent. For complex project management, you'll need desktop.

My techs complete 90% of their monday.com work on mobile. The 10% that requires desktop is planning and reporting.

14
jasontechguy•5 days ago

The mobile app has improved significantly in the last year. The latest updates made it actually usable for real work.

Game-changers for field work: • Widgets — add monday.com widgets to your phone home screen for quick status updates • Shortcuts — iOS/Android shortcuts for common actions • Camera integration — scan barcodes/QR codes directly into item fields

Setup tips: 1. Create a 'Mobile View' for each board with only essential columns 2. Use the 'My Work' section — it's the fastest way to see assigned items 3. Enable biometric login — saves time vs typing password 4. Use the share sheet — create items from photos/documents in other apps

Limitations to know: • Can't create new boards or complex automations • Formula columns are read-only • Mirror columns sometimes don't sync immediately

For your use case (status, photos, time tracking), it's more than adequate. For complex data entry, stick to desktop.
